question: Which of the following is not a characteristic of the soap opera as it appears in many parts of the world?

answers.text: The target audience is both men and women.

Soap operas in many cultures feature female characters that are both the ideal “woman” and “wife” and those who are considered not the norm or socially acceptable—the compliant and self-sacrificing versus the outspoken and reckless.
Like sitcoms in the United States, soap operas in many cultures instill attitudes on gender roles, family, and work.
They are a means to instill cultural values and morality.
